entry.content: Today we say goodbye to two great and long time staff members of /g/tracker and other InstallGentoo services. dellfag and pictron have been with installgentoo since the early days of the tracker and have helped to build this community in to what it is today. entry.title: Moving of the status blog.
entry.content:
Our status blog has been moved an reworked countless times, and this is just another one of those times.

I have moved it to, yes, loltumblr.  For a few reasons…

First being I strongly feel that blogger is gonna get the axe one of these days, its stale, its stagnant, and just all around shit.  I can easily see google pulling the plug.

Next tumblr and newer blogging platforms have better integration with social media and other things. As well as just being all around newer, fresher and better feeling.

Some of you may be asking, like many others have, why I am not hosting my own blog.  Well if something happens, to say, all of the servers how would I let you know?

So for now we are on tumblr, I am silently contemplating moving to wordpress.com but tumblr is good enough for now.

entry.title: FTP connecting issues
entry.content:
It came to my attention that sometime last night users were having trouble connecting to the FTP server. After looking into this vsftpd seems to be having issues, and specifically issues with the version packaged for debian wheezy.

To resolve this I have moved us over a different daemon, until vsftpd can get fixed.

entry.title: Public Statement Regarding the FTP and etc.
entry.content:
Okay since I have been asking several times about what is going on, I have decided to post a statement about our FTP service.

First a little back story…

There was a new #/g/tracker user/member who showed up around a month ago. This user/member was a very odd user who often brought up arguments on strange topics.

This member while a nuisance was tolerated as we are not an elitist group that silences people that annoy us.

Until this member, dropped dox on another member and attempted to on two other staff members. This is not tolerated in our humble community and he was banned. His /g/mail was also disabled in the process.

This made the now bannished member upset and he decided to report our FTP service to our hosting provider and to some copyright watchdog groups. Thus unleashing a huge shit storm upon /g/ and installgentoo.com community.

So the staff and myself went into containment mode, our primary irc channel was on lock down, the ftp was turned off and our main site was changed.

That is entire story, anything else was pure speculation or lie.


Today the staff has made some decisions on how things will be changed from now on.

  • First ftp access will be brought back shortly though with a new password, this password will rotate monthly and be posted in #/g/ftp on our irc.
  • We also plan on changing which web irc clients will be permitted to access our irc server, soon it will be just our own ran webirc client, sorry.
  • Our main site will return shortly, probably with some new design.
  • Some new more clear cut rules, apparently some do not know doxxing without permission is bad.



For now that is all, please if you have any questions you should now how to contact me.

Also if you really desire to see a real shit thread you can view that here, most of that thread is speculation and lies.  But hey you’re gonna believe what you’re gonna believe.

I am sorry for the downtime of our loyal users.

entry.title: Big Update
entry.content:
I have been very, very busy as of late but have managed to make several changes behind the scenes.  This includes adding services, changing services, and removing services.  I thought it would be best to explain in a post all of the changes instead of several.

Changes:
Last week we successfully moved the ftp, tracker, and blogs to a much more powerful server.  So you should notice those services are quite quicker.

Things going away/already gone:

  • http://chan.installgentoo.com - not enough interest
  • http://radio.installgentoo.com - icecast is really great but not enough interest to dj and listen



New things:

  • http://status.installgentoo.com - is now our blogger status blog, status was running on an amazon ec2 instance but now that our free tier is running out we needed to find an alternative.  
  • http://servers.installgentoo.com - the 2nd half of our status site was the server checker, this has been moved off of ec2 and installed on a free web host (for now).
  • mumble.installgentoo.com - now is set for max audio quality 
  • http://music.installgentoo.com - is back by popular demand, still in beta testing but this is now a subsonic instance streaming the ftp music folder.
  • http://archive.installgentoo.com - is back as well but this time as a nice foolfuuka archiver, for now we are just archiving /g/ those this will probably change.  Also on this site is /IG/ and a spot for our own chan (like chan.IG), I will probably redirect chan.installgentoo.com here.
  • http://bb.installgentoo.com - a more persistent form of communication and community is being tested and tweaked, so this is coming soon.
  • New ftp status pages: http://ftp.installgentoo.com/vnstat/ and http://ftp.installgentoo.com/sysinfo/
  • http://etherpad.installgentoo.com - just another etherpad instance
  • nntp://news.installgentoo.com - our own private usenet server (local groups only), I will be making a tutorial on how to connect soon.


Well, I think that about covers everything.
